answerText: neutrophils [or neutrophil granulocytes][10] Neutrophils are the most abundant types of these immune cells in mammals. With platelets, they form the buffy coat in a centrifuged blood sample and occupy about 1% of blood volume.
heading: DEES |2014 | WUSTL  | 15 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These cells form a series of "extracellular traps" that capture pathogens.  [10] Name these granulocytes with nuclei that appear to be segmented or have lobes. They tend not to retain dyes during smears or stains.
